meanings.definition: To transfer or pass from one to another
meanings.sent1: She transfuses her knowledge to her students during every class.
meanings.sent2: The nurse transfuses blood from the donor to the patient in need.
meanings.sent3: The magician transfuses magic from his hat to the rabbit, making it disappear.
meanings.sent4: The storyteller transfuses emotions from her words to the listeners, making them feel deeply.
meanings.sent5: The sun transfuses warmth to the earth, bringing life to all living things.

meanings.definition: To cause to pass from one to another
meanings.sent1: The chef transfuses flavors into the dish by adding various spices.
meanings.sent2: The electric current transfuses energy from the battery to the device.
meanings.sent3: The comedian transfuses laughter to the audience with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: The leader transfuses motivation to the team, inspiring them to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The artist transfuses creativity into her paintings, making them unique and captivating.
